message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a new loss function for data-imbalanced NLP tasks, which is a common problem in natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the theoretical analysis of the proposed method, which suggests that it could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper proposes a new approach to weight training examples, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The proposed method could also be applied to computer vision tasks, which suggests the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision) as a possibility. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on named entity recognition tasks, which suggests the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possibility.
